qas.question: What is worshipped during Tibet's various festibals?
What is the Tibetan New Year Festival called?
What do Tibetan's eat on New Year's Eve?
When is the Monlam Prayer Festival?

answers.text: between the fourth and the eleventh days of the first Tibetan month

qas.question: Who established the Monlam Prayer Festival in 1049?
What event was established by Khapa Tsong?
What event follows the Monlam Prayer Festival?

context: Tibet has various festivals that are commonly performed to worship the <a0_0>Buddha<a0_0/>[citation needed] throughout the year. <a1_0><b8_0>Losar<b8_0/><a1_0/> is the Tibetan New Year Festival. Preparations for the festive event are manifested by special offerings to family shrine deities, painted doors with religious symbols, and other painstaking jobs done to prepare for the event. Tibetans eat <a2_0>Guthuk<a2_0/> (barley noodle soup with filling) on New Year's Eve with their families. <b5_0><b6_0><b7_0>The Monlam Prayer Festival<b7_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/> follows it in the first month of the Tibetan calendar, falling <a3_0>between the fourth and the eleventh days of the first Tibetan month<a3_0/>. It involves dancing and participating in sports events, as well as sharing picnics. The event was established in 1049 by <a4_0>Tsong Khapa<a4_0/>, the founder of the Dalai Lama and the Panchen Lama's order.
